newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Eletrobras S.A. 1st half net lower.
newsitem.headline: Eletrobras S.A. 1st half net lower.

text.p: Brazilian federal power holding Eletrobras S.A. reported the following first-half 1997 financial results.
NOTE: Figures are in Brazilian reais and are not adjusted for inflation.
In a statement, Eletrobras said last year's first half earnings benefitted from the May 1996 sale of Rio de Janeiro electric utility Light, which netted the firm 337 million reais.
Excluding the once-off gain, Eletrobras' January-June 1997 net profit was 18 percent higher than the same period last year, it said.

Note: Eletrobras said first half sales systemwide rose 10.9 percent compared with the same period a year ago.
Total assets in the period reached 77 billion reais, while permanent assets, comprised of investments in subsidiaries and associated firms and Itaipu dam, totalled 47 billion reais.

Financial credits reached 27 billion reais, of which 64 percent with Itaipu, 20 percent with subsidiaries, and 16 percent with associated firms. Liabilities with financial institutions totalled five billion reais, it added.
